channel.title: Different EXP Rates for Different Ranks
channel.description:
Hello, I'm the owner of Disturbed718.
Neither me or my Developer (who is NOT a so-called "nooby" coder), haven't got the slightest idea on how to do this:
I'm 95% sure that everyone here knows the server "SoulSplit," so I'm going to assume that it's probably not against the rules for me to say that here. IF you've ever played that server, then you know that when you register a new account, it gives you 4 different options on what experience rate you want to use, each of which having a different benefit. I know you're probably wondering what base we're using, and it's actually a Rune-Evo source. If you know how to do any of the thing's I last said, please inform me on how to do these thing's in the reply section below.
Thanks, and have a good day.
Regards, Tyler

item.title: Different EXP Rates for Different Ranks
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:8, topic:535138”]public World getWorld() = new World();

[code=Java]public class World {
public World() {}

List<Player> players = new ArrayList<Player>();

public Player getPlayer(int pid_) {
    return players.get(pid_);
}

}[/code]

[code=Java]public class Player {
public Player() {}

public void sendGamePacket(Packet opcode_, String... data_) {
    if (opcode_ == 253) {
        for (String msg_ : data_) {
            sendMessage(msg_);
        }
    }
}

public void sendMessage(String msg_) {
    System.out.println(msg_);
}

[/code]

just another example of pseudo-code.

i can take the standard “SEND_MESSAGE” method, and add a few constructors and BOOM looks just like a higher revision![/quote]
exactly, java is java lol

Read full topic
item.source: Different EXP Rates for Different Ranks

item.title: Different EXP Rates for Different Ranks
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:


[code=Java]public class World {
    public World() {}

    List<Player> players = new ArrayList<Player>();

    public Player getPlayer(int pid_) {
        return players.get(pid_);
    }
}[/code]

[code=Java]public class Player {
    public Player() {}

    public void sendGamePacket(Packet opcode_, String... data_) {
        if (opcode_ == 253) {
            for (String msg_ : data_) {
                sendMessage(msg_);
            }
        }
    }

    public void sendMessage(String msg_) {
        System.out.println(msg_);
    }
[/code]




[code=Java]getWorld.getPlayer(player_id).sendGamePacket(253, "Example");[/code]




just another example of pseudo-code.

i can take the standard "SEND_MESSAGE" method, and add a few constructors and BOOM looks just like a higher revision!

[code=Java]public class World {
public World() {}

List<Player> players = new ArrayList<Player>();

public Player getPlayer(int pid_) {
    return players.get(pid_);
}

}[/code]

[code=Java]public class Player {
public Player() {}

public void sendGamePacket(Packet opcode_, String... data_) {
    if (opcode_ == 253) {
        for (String msg_ : data_) {
            sendMessage(msg_);
        }
    }
}

public void sendMessage(String msg_) {
    System.out.println(msg_);
}

[/code]

just another example of pseudo-code.

i can take the standard “SEND_MESSAGE” method, and add a few constructors and BOOM looks just like a higher revision!

Read full topic

item.title: Different EXP Rates for Different Ranks
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

[quote=“Tyler7835, post:5, topic:535138”]It’s not simple with a 718 source, the only sources that have really ever been able to do this are average 317s such as PI, and a Zenith 667 source.

He said he can’t figure out how to add XP rates through an options dialogue.

Simple shit, lolk.[/quote]you dont add anything through an options dialogue.

if he knows how to do dialogues, then he’s set.

pseudo:

handleClick(int child_) { switch (child_) { case 1: XP_MOD = 10; break; case 2: XP_MOD = 5; break; case 3: XP_MOD = 1; break; default: XP_MOD = 10; break; }

boolean grantExperience(int skill_, int amount_) { player.experience[skill_] += (amount_ * XP_MOD); }

for future advice: if you don’t know how to do something, just admit that you don’t know how. you’ll get much further help than acting like you know what you’re doing.

Read full topic

item.title: Different EXP Rates for Different Ranks
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

login
fill interface children with text for options of each rank
display interface
handle clicking packet for each line
set some player variable to specific id for each rank
save variable to player
in experience-adding methods, check each rank and use multipliers
add experience
